oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Jim Bulleit face-to-face Interview Tape 1 of 2 Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Record industry pioneer Jim Bulleit talks about his career in the music business, focusing on his WSM days, his record label Bullet Records, and his work as a booking agent. Discussion includes various artists from the Bullet catalogue; the contract arrangement for Bullet artists; WSM programming and personalities; Bullet distribution and promotion; opening the first record processing plant in Nashville; the end of Bullet Records; the Village and Delta record labels; his publishing interests; Lefty Frizzell and Don Law; overseeing the booking and the artists for the Louisiana Hayride; his work at Sun Records; the attempt to revive Bullet Records; and memories of Fred Rose.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jim Bulleit
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two, Tape 1 of 2 (00:00) -- Continued discussion about the record distribution plants of Bullet Records. (2:50) -- Jim Bulleit describes studio costs and production processes of making a record. (4:26) -- Jim Bulleit mentions that he used to produce records at the cost of only $500, for artists such as Cecil Gant. (5:00) John Rumble asks about other labels and their connection to Bullet. (5:26) -- John Rumble asks about Jim Bulleit's decision to sell out. (7:48) -- Jim Bulleit reminisces on the beginning of Rock N' Roll. (9:40) -- Jim Bulleit describes the end of Bullet Records and its disappearance. (10:23) -- John Rumble asks about Bullet Records leasing masters to other record labels. Jim Bulleit setup Dot Records with their first artists and distributors (such as The Fairfield Four). (11:48) -- John Rumble inquires about Bullet Record's international distribution. (13:43) -- John Rumble asks Jim Bulleit about his knowledge on other record labels such as World Records, Village, and Delta. (15:18) -- John Rumble asks Jim Bulleit about his publishing pursuits. (17:10) -- Jim Bulleit describes his other publishing companies such as JD Music and Jim Bulleit Music Corporation. (20:24) -- John Rumble asks Jim Bulleit about how Lefty Frizzell and Don Law were connected. (22:01) -- John Rumble asks about Jim Bulleit's BMI contract. (23:52) -- John Rumble asks about The Louisiana Hayride.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Bulleit, Jim;
